sentence.value: Igor Volk was selected as a cosmonaut on July 30, 1980, flew as Research Cosmonaut on Soyuz T-12, the 7th expedition to Salyut 7.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Igor Volk|Igor_Volk]] was selected as [[a cosmonaut|Astronaut]] on [[July|July]] 30, 1980, flew as [[Research|Research]] [[Cosmonaut|Astronaut]] on [[Soyuz|Soyuz_T-12]] [[T-12|T-12_antitank_gun]], the 7th [[expedition|Exploration]] to [[Salyut 7|Salyut_7]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Igor Volk|Igor_Volk]] was selected as [[a cosmonaut|Astronaut]] on July 30, 1980, flew as Research [[Cosmonaut|Astronaut]] on [[Soyuz|Soyuz_T-12]] T-12, the 7th expedition to Salyut 7.

sentence.value: One goal of the mission was to test the effects of long-duration spaceflight on Volk's return flight piloting as a precursor to piloting the Space Shuttle Buran.

sentence.value: He served as the head of the cosmonauts training for the Buran program and since the project's cancellation, as a Flight Tests Deputy at the Gromov Flight Research Institute in 1995 before retiring in 1996.

sentence.value: As recognition for his contributions as a test pilot and cosmonaut he was awarded the Hero of the Soviet Union on July 29, 1984.
sentence.annotated-sentence: As recognition for [[his contributions|Fundraising]] as a [[test|Test_pilot]][[test pilot|Test_pilot]] and cosmonaut he was awarded [[the Hero of the Soviet Union|Hero_of_the_Soviet_Union]] on [[July|July]] 29, 1984.

sentence.value: He is also an inventor and is planning a new four-person concept flying car called the Lark-4 which takes off and lands at 45 km/h (28 mph) using a 27-meter (89 feet) runway.
